techniques.name: Scrambling
techniques.description: A mix of hiking and climbing, often on steep rocky slopes.

techniques.name: Rock Climbing
techniques.description: Using hands and feet to climb rock faces; may involve ropes and harnesses.

techniques.name: Ice Climbing
techniques.description: Using ice axes and crampons to ascend frozen surfaces.

techniques.name: Mixed Climbing
techniques.description: Combining rock and ice climbing techniques.

techniques.name: Belaying
techniques.description: Controlling the rope to catch a climber in case of a fall.

techniques.name: Rappelling (Abseiling)
techniques.description: Descending a rope using a friction device.

techniques.name: Fixed Ropes
techniques.description: Ropes anchored along a route for assistance.

techniques.name: Glacier Travel & Rope Teaming
techniques.description: Moving across glaciers while roped together to prevent falls into crevasses.

techniques.name: French Technique (Flat-Footing)
techniques.description: Used in snow and ice, keeping crampons flat for stability.

techniques.name: Front-Pointing
techniques.description: Using crampon front points on steep ice.

techniques.name: Rest Stepping
techniques.description: A slow, controlled way to conserve energy while ascending.

techniques.name: Self-Arrest
techniques.description: Using an ice axe to stop a fall on a snowy or icy slope.

techniques.name: Map Reading & Compass Use
techniques.description: Essential for backcountry travel.

techniques.name: GPS & Altimeter Use
techniques.description: Helps track location and altitude.

techniques.name: Route Planning
techniques.description: Identifying safe paths while avoiding hazards like avalanches or crevasses.

techniques.name: Kick-Stepping
techniques.description: Creating steps in the snow with boots.

techniques.name: Ice Screw & Snow Anchor Placement
techniques.description: Securing protection in snow and ice.

techniques.name: Crevasse Rescue
techniques.description: Techniques like the Z-Pulley System to pull out a fallen climber.

techniques.name: Gradual Ascent
techniques.description: Helps the body adjust to lower oxygen levels.

techniques.name: Hydration & Nutrition
techniques.description: Prevents altitude sickness.

techniques.name: Recognizing AMS (Acute Mountain Sickness)
techniques.description: Knowing when to descend if symptoms appear.

techniques.name: Snow Shelters & Bivouacs
techniques.description: Emergency shelters for extreme conditions.

techniques.name: Fire & Cooking at High Altitudes
techniques.description: Adjusting for low oxygen and temperature.

techniques.name: Emergency First Aid
techniques.description: Treating hypothermia, frostbite, and altitude sickness.
